      58             : /**
      59             :  * Manage async composition effects. This class is only used with OMTC and only
      60             :  * lives on the compositor thread. It is a layer on top of the layer manager
      61             :  * (LayerManagerComposite) which deals with elements of composition which are
      62             :  * usually dealt with by dom or layout when main thread rendering, but which can
      63             :  * short circuit that stuff to directly affect layers as they are composited,
      64             :  * for example, off-main thread animation, async video, async pan/zoom.
      65             :  */

     164             :   /**
     165             :    * Adds a translation to the transform of any fixed position (whose parent
     166             :    * layer is not fixed) or sticky position layer descendant of
     167             :    * |aTransformedSubtreeRoot|. The translation is chosen so that the layer's
     168             :    * anchor point relative to |aTransformedSubtreeRoot|'s parent layer is the same
     169             :    * as it was when |aTransformedSubtreeRoot|'s GetLocalTransform() was
     170             :    * |aPreviousTransformForRoot|. |aCurrentTransformForRoot| is
     171             :    * |aTransformedSubtreeRoot|'s current GetLocalTransform() modulo any
     172             :    * overscroll-related transform, which we don't want to adjust for.
     173             :    * For sticky position layers, the translation is further intersected with
     174             :    * the layer's sticky scroll ranges.
     175             :    * This function will also adjust layers so that the given content document
     176             :    * fixed position margins will be respected during asynchronous panning and
     177             :    * zooming.
     178             :    * |aTransformScrollId| is the scroll id of the scroll frame that scrolls
     179             :    * |aTransformedSubtreeRoot|.
     180             :    * |aClipPartsCache| optionally maps layers to separate fixed and scrolled
     181             :    * clips, so we can only adjust the fixed portion.
     182             :    * This function has a recursive implementation; aStartTraversalAt specifies
     183             :    * where to start the current recursion of the traversal. For the initial
     184             :    * call, it should be the same as aTrasnformedSubtreeRoot.
     185             :    */
